results.title: Bent not broken
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Up to 60% of refugees to Australia have experienced torture. Through interviews with survivors of torture, and by interviewing health workers and activists committed to supporting torture victims, we gain insight into the psychological, physical and emotional damage inflicted on people by organised state terrorism. “Bent not broken” is a compassionate and non- exploitative study of torture and trauma survivors in Australia and the video details the efforts of individuals and community organisations to address the needs of refugees coming to terms with past experiences of violence.

results.title: Uranium fission: atomic energy
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 5 of Series “Atomic physics: an historical approach”
The fission of uranium and the development of the atomic bomb. There are many shots of actual apparatus, and some animated diagrams which illustrate the principles involved in the use of the cyclotron. Rutherford is introduced to speak on different aspects of atomic research; Einstein speaks during a short interview.

results.title: Cos school sucks, Miss
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A documentary made in response to Arabic community concern at the relatively high level of academic failure amongst Arab-Australian youth. The video explores the initial inadequacy of the Australian education system to deal with young people from an Islamic background, and who were often refugees. In the last few years Language Centres have been set up to assist newly arrived migrant youth to integrate into the mainstream education system, but the video points out the importance of Arabic-speaking teachers in the school environment, to act as a point of liaison between parents and students. One of the greatest difficulties for Arabic-Australians is the conflict between a family home which stresses tradition and community responsibility, and a peer and social environment which values individual freedom.

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women’s Program of the AFC
results.description:

Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.

results.title: Small pebbles on a giant shore
results.creator_credit: Maria Stratford and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes problems of disabled non-English speaking immigrants in Australia. Shows how some of these special groups have received assistance through the help of ADEC (Action on Disability within Ethnic Communities).

results.title: Australian women's archival Series
results.brief_description: Each year the Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission produces an archival interview with a woman who has made a significant contribution to Australia during her lifetime.

results.title: Something shining
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Something shining tells the story of a young pilot, Frederick Valentich, who disappeared with his small plane over Bass Strait as he returned from a flight to King Island. His enigmatic message of sighting “something shining” just before he disappeared has led many, including his parents, to believe he was captured by a UFO.

results.title: The Tempest in Bali
results.creator_credit: Ugo Mariotti, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In 1988 a group of students from Murdoch University under the leadership of David George and Serge Tampalini staged a production of Shakespeare’s “The Tempest” in Bali during the monsoon. The program documents the various bureaucratic problems they encountered and the assimilation of Balinese dance, music and shadow puppets into the production.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.

results.title: The Reefkeepers
results.creator_credit: Robert Alcock, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Shows the life and work of officers and crew aboard the ship, Cape Moreton, as they maintain shipping beacons and lighthouses in the tropics around Torres Strait. Examines the role of the Australian Lighthouse Service.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Shows the life and work of officers and crew aboard the ship, Cape Moreton, as they maintain shipping beacons and lighthouses in the tropics around Torres Strait. Examines the role of the Australian Lighthouse Service.

Shows the life and work of officers and crew aboard the ship, Cape Moreton, as they maintain shipping beacons and lighthouses in the tropics around Torres Strait. Examines the role of the Australian Lighthouse Service.
